urlfetch.UrlFetchApp.name: UrlFetchApp
urlfetch.UrlFetchApp.doc: Fetch resources and communicate with other hosts over the Internet.

method.name: fetch
method.doc: Makes a request to fetch a URL.

method.name: fetch
method.doc: Makes a request to fetch a URL using optional advanced parameters.

argument.name: params
argument.doc: optional JavaScript object specifying advanced parameters as defined below

method.name: fetchAll
method.doc: Makes multiple requests to fetch multiple URLs using optional advanced parameters.

argument.name: requests
argument.doc: array of either URLs, or JavaScript objects specifying requests as defined below

method.name: getRequest
method.doc: Returns the request that would be made if the operation was invoked.

method.name: getRequest
method.doc: Returns the request that would be made if the operation were invoked.

argument.name: params
argument.doc: optional JavaScript object specifying advanced parameters as defined below

urlfetch.HTTPResponse.name: HTTPResponse
urlfetch.HTTPResponse.doc: This class allows users to access specific information on HTTP responses.

method.name: getAllHeaders
method.doc: Returns an attribute/value map of headers for the HTTP response, with headers that have multiple values returned as arrays.

method.name: getAs
method.doc: Return the data inside this object as a blob converted to the specified content type.

argument.name: contentType
argument.doc: the MIME type to convert to. For most blobs, 'application/pdf' is the only valid option. For images in BMP, GIF, JPEG, or PNG format, any of 'image/bmp', 'image/gif', 'image/jpeg', or 'image/png' are also valid.

method.name: getBlob
method.doc: Return the data inside this object as a blob.

method.name: getContent
method.doc: Gets the raw binary content of an HTTP response.

method.name: getContentText
method.doc: Gets the content of an HTTP response encoded as a string.

method.name: getContentText
method.doc: Returns the content of an HTTP response encoded as a string of the given charset.

argument.name: charset
argument.doc: a string representing the charset to be used for encoding the HTTP response content

method.name: getHeaders
method.doc: Returns an attribute/value map of headers for the HTTP response.

method.name: getResponseCode
method.doc: Get the HTTP status code (200 for OK, etc.) of an HTTP response.
